title.english: Kimi ni Todoke: From Me to You Season 2

description:
The second season of Kimi ni Todoke.

Sawako Kuronuma and her friends have just begun their second year of high school and they are in the same class together again. To make matters more interesting a male student newly transferred into their class is seated right next to Kuronuma and has taken an interest in her. What hurdles will Sawako and Kazehaya face next?

Note: Includes episode 0, "Kataomoi/A Crush".

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

title.native: 君に届け ミニトド劇場

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石川光久)

Co-founder and representative director of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). The studio is named after him and [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/).

Ishikawa acted as executive producer for the anime sequence The Origin of Ren in Kill Bill, and was the producer of the first two [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/) films. In 2005, Ishikawa joined his first joint Japanese-U.S. collaboration, since the opening of the Production I.G branch in Los Angeles, IGPX: Immortal Grand Prix, a joint production with Production I.G and Cartoon Network. Ishikawa has also produced Batman: Gotham Knight, Halo Legends and Dante's Inferno: An Animated Epic.

He also served as an executive at Bee Train from 1997 to 2006.

(Source: Wikipedia)

S.E.N.S. is a Japanese new age instrumental group formed in 1988, originally with two members. The name stands for "Sound, Earth, Nature, and Spirit" based on their spiritual policy.  They have produced many musical scores for TV dramas, documentaries, and movies in Japan, also making it into the anime scene with the score for xxxHolic.

name.native: トモフミ タニザワ

node.description: Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gwada_wit)

President of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Co-founder and representative director of [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
Makiko Yamazaki is a photographer and CG artist.
